title:
"Had Prime Minister Narendra Modi not attained the height of power in politics, he would have reached the heights of fame in theatre. For that is all that his nearly uncontrollable rage at having been thwarted from reaching Hussainiwala for his scheduled public meeting on January 5 was – pure theatre. "

Prem Shankar Jha at razor-sharp best.
author: Siddharth-Varadarajan

title: Here is our first BIG EXCLUSIVE of 2022 — A great digital forensic investigation by Ayushman Kaul and Devesh Kumar for The Wire on the sinister, large-scale political manipulation of cyberspace by operatives linked to BJP.

title: गुजरात सरकार द्वारा जिस कंपनी के ‘दस दिनों’ में कोविड मरीज़ों के लिए वेंटिलेटर्स बनाने का दावा किया गया था, जिन्हें राज्य के डॉक्टरों में मानकों पर खरा न उतरने की बात कही थी, उस कंपनी के प्रमोटर्स उसी उद्योगपति परिवार से जुड़े हैं, जिन्होंने साल 2015 में प्रधानमंत्री नरेंद्र मोदी को उनका नाम लिखा सूट तोहफ़े में दिया था.

author: Siddharth-Varadarajan

title:
“The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh survived for 95 years with a cultural nationalism fuelled by its anti-Muslim agenda. The RSS-BJP never thought of improving the skills of India’s labour force as they come from the so-called lower castes. While Chinese Confucianism, Buddhism and Marxism believe in human equality and dignity of labour, the RSS’s ideology is rooted in Kautilya, Manu and Golwalkar’s thought and it never campaigned for human equality and dignity of labour. How can it challenge the Chinese labour force, which lives labour as life? Can the slogan of “Jai Sri Ram” challenge the Chinese slogan, “Let a hundred flowers bloom and a thousand schools of thought contend”? This slogan may never have been implemented in the political sphere but who can deny the phenomenal growth of China’s economy is the result of a thousand natural science and social science thoughts expanding and contending?”

Kancha Ilaiah Shepherd writes.
author: Siddharth-Varadarajan

title:
"A national lockdown is precisely the time when journalists in a democracy need to be free to write and report without worrying about a midnight knock. Only by doing our jobs can we ensure not only that ordinary citizens come out of the pandemic alive, but that their democracy does so, too."--

Siddharth Varadarajan on India's democratic decline and the persecution of independent journalists.
author: Siddharth-Varadarajan

title:
This is an amazing interview, in which Prashant Kishor — easily India's most-in-demand political consultant who helped generate big electoral wins for
Narendra Modi, Nitish Kumar, Arvind Kejriwal and is now working with Mamata Banerjee and Jaganmohan Reddy — opens up to Karan Thapar about his approach and method of work.
author: Siddharth-Varadarajan

title: Read this open letter from Anand Teltumbde—thoughtful professor, intellectual and, above all, innocent man—and pity what India has become that someone like him can be condemned to indefinite pre-conviction imprisonment on the flimsiest of 'evidence'.

title:
He had one job to do, just one job—announce the 21 day lockdown and say there is no need to worry if you don't have food for the whole period in your house because we are going to make sure essential supplies will function and will get to you. But no, Modiji being Modiji has to mess things up and send tens of thousands of people onto the streets and markets in panic. Then he tweets in all caps 40 minutes later: THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO NEED TO PANIC.

What was he thinking?
author: Siddharth-Varadarajan
